page.title: 17New Industries in Linwood
page.content: When the Linwood Car Plant closed in 1982 it left 3000 people unemployed directly and a thousand more in other industries on part time work. There has, however, been continued redevelopment in Linwood. The former Talbot Car PLant has been split into smaller factory units, and let at reduced rates. This complex is known as{JUNCTION 29}(referring to the nearby motorway junction). The main user is{BRITOIL}who have taken over the office accommodation.Another main user is{REID GEAR}. There is also a company called{AIR PARK}offering a secure parking service to business men using{Glasgow Airport}. In 1983 work started on the development of small modern factory units beside St Brendan's High School. They employ around 150 people and are a{Scottish {Development Agency}project.
